title: Overview
text: This is a personal site that I used to render experiments and workflows that relate to the price statistics domain within official statistics. It is meant to show work in a reproducible manner for anyone else who chooses to look at this. As its personal, it is not meant in any official capacity.

title: Aizcorbe (2014), ex 2.2. Bilateral indices
text:
Example of bilateral indices with product churn (from Aizcorbe 2014, example 2.2)
In Example 2.2, Aizcorbe uses the DRAM dataset to demonstrate how to construct bilateral price indices with product churn.

title: Aizcorbe (2014), ex 3.2. Hedonic dummy variable method
text:
Example of dummy variable hedonic method (from Aizcorbe 2014, example 3.2)
In Example 3.2, constructed a sythentic scanner dataset

title: Notes on bilateral price index methods
text:
This page provides an overview of Bilateral Price Index methods. Several sources are used (included in the links to the page) to go over key concepts. Emprical examples are linked from this page or can be found in the main guide

A price index provides an aggregate measure of price change for a particular product segment, industry, or overall economy. … [They compare] the cost of purchasing a set of goods at different points in time. This “set of goods” is often referred to as the “market basket” or the “bundle” of goods. - Aizcorbe (2014)
crumbs: Notes on bilateral price index methods
